# 4 Step-By-Step Preparation
::: l-body
|No| Step                | Action                                       |
|--|---------------------|----------------------------------------------|
|1| Select only the top table for each data set and paste into a new sheet using Microsoft Excel.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|2| Import the data into Tableau.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|3| Use Tableau to pivot the data in sheet, with measure values in columns and age in rows.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|4| Remove the CNT in Measure Values.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|5| View the data in Tableau.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|6| Export the data and save the file with an appropriate name.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|7| Repeat steps 1 â€“ 6 for both Male and Female sections. Merge the exported files using Microsoft Excel and add a Category column to identify the dataset source.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|8| Import the cleaned dataset into Tableau.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|9| Change the LFPR from value to percentage by adding a calculated field.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
|10| 	Change the data types to the correct ones and rename columns for better clarity.| ![](./images/logo.png){#id .class width=50% height=50%}|
